comment.author: 34427466731@N01
comment._content: "The Constantine Pillar stands on the avenue that links Sultanahmet Square to Beyazit and was built in 330. Today's pillar is rather smaller than the original monument. Its marble crests were added in the 12th century and the reinforcements at its bottom were added during the 18th century. Due to the fact that the monument was damaged by fire over its long history, it was outfitted with protective iron hoops." www.pamediakopes.gr/destination-guides/istanbul-sightseei...

comment.author: 21495118@N08
comment._content: It is also known as Çemberlitaş in Turkish

comment.author: 80713190@N03
comment._content: Si tratta di 7 rocchi di porfido rosso egiziano con una decorazione a serti gemmati che nascondono le giunture dei pezzi di marmo. Il basamento è invece ottomano e nasconde un più antico basamento rettangolare la cui forma ci è tramandata da un disegno cinquecentesco conservato a Cambridge, nella Biblioteca del Trinity College.
